alert.note: Alert for Comal; Hays; Travis (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 21 at 8:21PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Hays, central Travis and Comal Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 821 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Mansfield Dam to near Bulverde. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Austin, New Braunfels, Kyle, Buda, Dripping Springs, Wimberley, Tanglewood Forest, Canyon Lake Dam, Canyon Lake, Lakeway, Manor, Bee Cave, Bulverde, West Lake Hills, The Hills, Woodcreek, Rollingwood, Bear Creek, Smithson Valley and Barton Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Texas.
